segments.text: I look at the girl with her arm raised, hope shimmering in her eyes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy’s determination to grab those cookies is almost admirable, but reckless.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a pang of annoyance at how the woman is completely unaware of the chaos brewing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s as if the house and the outside world are disconnected; one piece is serene while the other is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is now a small river, stretching across the floor, and I can only shake my head in disbelief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but wonder if they’ll all slip and fall; it's a terrifying thought.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Still, I can’t deny it’s a sight that captures the essence of childhood mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR
